Query: Test if remote TCP port is open from a shell script

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Show all TCP sockets along with processes connected to a remote ssh port
Top-3 Similar Questions: so_19261962: with root, open other process socket and get tcp_info with python?
au_1265361: How to open ports not only locally?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_19261962: #!/usr/bin/python
from subprocess import check_output as co

co("ss -tp > ss.out", shell=True)
rtts = co("cat ss.out | grep ESTAB | awk '{print $4}' | xargs -I {} ss -i 'src {}' | grep \"rtt:\" | awk '{print $4}' | cut -d : -f 2 | cut -d / -f 1", shell=True)
pids = co("cat ss.out | grep ESTAB | awk '{print $6}' | cut -d , -f 2", shell=True)

print zip(rtts.split('\n'), pids.split('\n'))

Explanations about Options.-l: Display only listening sockets (these are omitted by default).
Explanations about Options.-i: Show internal TCP information. Below fields may appear:
Explanations about Options.-n:
Do not try to resolve service names. Show exact bandwidth values, instead of human-
